id.description: Unique identifier for a build. Gets generated automatically on creation.

label.description: Label of the build. Typically contains the version of the release, the revision number of daily builds and a short name for experimental builds.

type.description:
Type of the build. Values:
* `release` - Official releases from the Visual Pinball dev team
* `nightly` - Automatic nightly builds
* `experimental` - Test builds, built by devs or others, very instable and bleeding edge.

description.description: A description of the build. Contains changelog for official releases. Is Markdown formatted.

platform.description: Platform of the build. Only Visual Pinball supported so far.

major_version.description: The major version branch of the version for the given platform. For VP9, that would be `9`.

built_at.description: Date when the build was, well, built.

is_range.description: Instead of covering one single release, it's also possible to create builds that cover a range of releases (e.g. `v8.x.x`).

is_active.description: When creating a new build, it first becomes inactive. When linking a release to the build, it becomes active.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the build was added to the database.

_created_by.description: Reference to the user who created this build. Only visible by contributors and above.
